p: The pattern of liver injury is again hepatocellular, though it may rarely be cholestatic with marked hyperbilirubinemia. Majority of the patients who develop hepatitis do not have concomitant signs and symptoms of IM, though it is accompanied by lymphocytosis and/or splenomegaly. EBV hepatitis affects an older demographic compared to IM, with nearly half of patients over 60 years old. It is usually a self-limiting hepatitis which improves with supportive management [ 9].
